text: Cuthbert Augustus "Bill" Pattillo (June 3, 1924 - February 20, 2014) was a Major General in the United States Air Force. He served in World War II and the Vietnam War. He worked as Director of Plans and Policy for the United States Readiness Command at MacDill Air Force Base. He was as a pioneer in jet aerobatic demonstration teams. He was born in Atlanta, Georgia. His twin brother was Charles C. Pattillo. Pattillo died from natural causes on February 20, 2014 at his home in Harrisonburg, Virginia. He was 89 years old. ==References== ==Other websites== * Cuthbert A. title: Cuthbert A. Pattillo
